p.s:
Located in the
South West Coast
region of
Victoria
, the town was settled only a few years after
Melbourne
, and is characterised by its strong European heritage , maritime and seafaring character and its lasting connection to the sea .
The town is dotted with museums , grand hotels and also a fine variety of restaurants and eateries .

It is most known as the port of call of the Searoad Ferry , which connections the region to
Portsea
on the
Mornington Peninsula
.

This guide also covers the adjacent tourist resort of
Point Lonsdale
, a popular destination for family getaways with its splendid beach .

McHarry ’s Buslines
run from Geelong to the Bellarine Peninsula towns of Barwon Heads , Ocean Grove , Pt Lonsdale and Queenscliff ( 30 km ) .

Car/passenger ferries cross the mouth of Port Phillip Bay between Queenscliff and Sorrento on
Mornington Peninsula
.
They depart each terminal on the hour every hour 7AM-6PM every day .
From 26 Dec. until end of daylight saving there are also 7PM sailings .

The channel through the heads is known as the Rip for its strong tidal currents .
There are short walks linking the Rip View Lookout , the pier and lighthouse .
